page.title: 12LAND COVER AROUND DALMALLY
page.content: Land cover around this area is mostly grass or trees, buildings are definately in the minority. Most grass or heathland is used for garzing for sheep occaisionally cattle. There is no crop growth except for some hay. Farms tend to cover a large area in order that sufficient grazing of quality may be found for the livestock. Of the tree covered land some belongs to the Forestry Commission and some to Economic Forestry. The Forestry Commision use this area as a nursery area for their trees. However much of the area is too hilly for the planting machinery and is therefore left as grass. Spraying of the trees with fertiliser is done by helicopter.
